modules.description: This module provides low-level functions for building and pushing Docker images using OCluster, including direct control over build specifications and cache hints. It operates on Git commit IDs, Docker image IDs, and obuilder job specifications, enabling precise pipeline definitions. Concrete use cases include defining custom Docker build steps with specific build pools and source repositories, and integrating image builds with external push targets in continuous integration workflows.

This module manages connections to an OCluster scheduler, handling job submission, automatic reconnection, rate-limited queuing, and metrics reporting. It works with OCluster submission services and job capabilities, allowing custom pipeline steps via direct interaction or integration with OCurrent jobs. Use it to submit actions to specific pools, manage job execution, and stream logs back to OCurrent job instances.

This module enables building and pushing Docker images and obuilder jobs using OCluster, interacting with Git commit IDs and Docker image specifications. It supports submitting jobs to specific build pools, managing urgency policies, and streaming logs to OCurrent job instances. Concrete use cases include defining CI/CD pipelines that build Docker images from Git sources and optionally push them to remote registries.
